data.title: Add public contribution guide
data.body:
We need to make the contributing guide available on atom.io since the current `CONTRIBUTING.md` in the atom/atom repository root won't be publicly visible. This guide focuses on contributing to packages since the core code won't be available until the end of the beta. It's intended to be linked from the `CONTRIBUTING.md` file of each public package.

In addition to revised content from the original `CONTRIBUTING.md`, there's now a guide to the basic workflow for hacking on a package, including a review of `apm develop`, `apm link -d`, and running in development mode.

data.title: Changes needed by markdown preview refactoring
data.body: This is a minor bug fix and moving parts of the Pane API to Workspace (so we don't need workspace view to handle with panes)

data.title: Rename workspace view pane methods
data.body: This renames methods on WorkspaceView that return PaneViews. Previously it appeared like the methods returned Pane objects. Now the methods are named so it is clear that they return PaneViews.

data.title: Extract TextBuffer
data.body:
- [x] Extract File class
- [x] Extract Directory class
- [x] Extract TextBuffer class
- [x] Add back Atom size limit on opened files
- [x] Add back `runas` support for saving files privileges

data.title: Check that all bundled modules have permissive licenses during CI build
data.body:
:lantern: **In Progress** :lantern:

Refs #1535

This PR should not go green until all bundled modules have a known permissive license. The following issues still need to be resolved:

**Determine whether licenses added in subsequent versions are sufficient or upgrade the following:**
- [x] domutils@1.0.1 (~~submitted a PR to gjtorikian/task-lists-js#2 to upgrade to a licensed dependency~~ now waiting on gjtorikian/roaster#5)

**Add licenses to all libraries controlled by GitHub:**
- [x] clear-cut
- [x] isbinaryfile
- [x] tasks-lists (asked @gjtorikian to publish w/ license in gjtorikian/task-lists-js#1)
- [x] packages derived from permissively-licensed TextMate bundles

**Convince author to add a license or switch to an alternative for the following libraries:**
- [x] replace (requested in harthur/replace#33)
- [x] slug (~~requested in dodo/node-slug#15~~ requested to drop the dependency in gjtorikian/roaster#6)
- [x] specificity (requested via PR in keeganstreet/specificity#7)
- [x] unicode (requested in dodo/node-unicodetable#13)

**Convince authors of unlicensed TextMate bundles we derive from to add licenses.**
- [x] coffee-script-tmbundle (requested in jashkenas/coffee-script-tmbundle/issues/153) just going to allow it for now and work it out later.

data.title: Remove TextMatePackage
data.body:
This updates all the `language-*` package to use Atom's package layout, allowing us to remove `TextMatePackage` from core.

`apm init --convert` now generates a package using the standard Atom package layout as well.

data.title: Remove some default packages
data.body:
Closes #1477
Refs #1537

data.title: Remove cli command install errors from logs
data.body:
Stop these:

```
EACCES, unlink '/usr/local/bin/atom'
EACCES, unlink '/usr/local/bin/apm'
```

data.title: Changes based on cleaning up grammar-selector
data.body: Cleaning up `SelectListView` based on reviewing the `grammar-selector` package.

data.title: Publishing doc
data.body:
A guide to publishing a package, feedback welcome.

Refs #1537

data.title: Enable privilege escalation when install command
data.body:
This PR uses node-runas to run command with privilege when got EACESS error while installing command, fixes #1463.

One problem is that Atom tries to install command on startup, so Atom would keep asking for user's password on startup if current user doesn't have write permission to '/user/local/bin', which is quite annoying.

data.title: Upgrade to atom-shell@v0.9.2
data.body: Fixes #1086 and a few other Windows quirks.

data.title: Log message about script/bootstrap when onload fails
data.body:
If a dev window fails to open, it can commonly be because they haven't run script/bootstrap in awhile and have pulled something that needs a new module.

Log a message about this to make it more clear.

data.title: It would be nice if Atom remembered my workspace layout (what files I had open) when it restarted
data.body:
It would be nice if Atom remembered my workspace layout (what files I had open) when it restarted (especially when it restarted due to an upgrade).

Atom Version: 0.50.0
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_9_1) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Atom/0.50.0 Atom-Shell/0.9.1 Safari/537.36

data.title: Cj move openers to workspace
data.body:
This moves methods from Project to Workspace where they make more sense.

We should also move all buffer and editor state out of project, but there aren't any public API's that reference those. So I left them out of the PR.

Closes #1533

data.title: Accidentally kicked my power cord out of the wall a minute ago. When my machine rebooted, Atom was
data.body:
Accidentally kicked my power cord out of the wall a minute ago. When my machine rebooted, Atom was the only running app that didn't restore its previous state.

Other stuff I was running at the time:
- Chrome
- Safari
- Rdio
- GHfM
- GHChat
- Terminal
- Calca

Atom Version: 0.49.0
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_9_1) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Atom/0.49.0 Atom-Shell/0.8.7 Safari/537.36

data.title: Beta Priorities
data.body:
- [x] invite system for beta users github/atom.io#195
- [x] update welcome package text atom/welcome#2
- [ ] clean up generated docs
- [x] doc publishing a package #1544 
- [x] list all licenses used by third-party code #1535 
- [x] review creating a theme doc #1572
- [x] doc working on an existing package (apm develop)
- [x] send feedback via e-mail atom/feedback#14
- [x] revisit the default packages #1477 
- [x] review markdown preview (pane API) atom/markdown-preview#11
- [x] review image-view (project opener API)
- [x] review whitespace (text manipulation API) atom/whitespace#7
- [x] review grammar-selector (select list API, status bar API, grammar API) atom/grammar-selector#3
- [x] review spellcheck API (marker API, task API)
- [ ] add grammar tutorial (use TOML)
- [x] doc converting a textmate theme
- [x] Add README and CONTRIBUTING to each package (Note if the package is experimental)
- [x] fix textmate snippets (remove or update snippets that use TM_\* vars atom/snippets#3
- [x] Use `Foo::bar` notation for instance methods in generated docs #1561
- [ ] ~~measuring what commands get run~~
- [ ] ~~remove all delegates~~
- [x] new icon

data.title: Blink all cursors in same interval
data.body:
Prevents cursor blink from going out of sync by using a single interval to update all current cursors.

Closes #1504

data.title: List every license for every library/framework Atom includes in its binary
data.body: This includes node modules, node module dependencies, chromium, chromium dependencies, node, node dependencies, etc...

data.title: Handle moving lines around folds
data.body:
Fixes for moving folded lines up/down and moving lines around folded lines.

Closes #1210

data.title: Move methods from Project to Workspace
data.body:
I think all of these methods make more sense on Workspace. We can delegate to Project and update the public API as a short term solution.
- [x] Project::registerOpener
- [x] Project::unregisterOpener
- [x] Project::eachEditor
- [x] Project::getEditors
- [x] Project::addEditor # This should be made private

data.title: Consistent font size commands
data.body:
- [x] Make increase/decrease font size commands consistent
- [x] Add `cmd-0` keybinding to reset the font size to the default

Closes #1462

data.title: Methods in Pane don't match our coding style
data.body: Methods like Pane::activeItem() https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/src/pane.coffee#L117 should be Pane:setActiveItem()

data.title: I'm refactoring. I press cmd-shift-f, type some characters, press enter, click on one of the search
data.body:
I'm refactoring. I press cmd-shift-f, type some characters, press enter, click on one of the search results, and replace the matching line with a new implementation.

I press cmd-shift-f again, press enter again because it's the only way I can see the search results without tabs, and the old version line I just changed is _still_ in the search results.

Occasionally the results will mix it up by giving me duplicate results for the same match: One with a path relative to the current project root and one with an absolute path.

I've reported this and related issues a few times now without getting much insight. I'd really like to know what I'm doing that makes search usless for me and OK for everybody else. What am I doing wrong?

Atom Version: 0.49.0
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_9_1) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Atom/0.49.0 Atom-Shell/0.8.7 Safari/537.36

data.title: Ask for privilege escalation when writing file on OS X
data.body: Fixes #310.

data.title: Tweak spec reporter styles
data.body:
- [x] Use tweaks from jasmine-focused to simplify stack traces
- [x] Use bootstrap styles
- [x] Show package name at top of runner
- [x] Prefix failure descriptions with _it_ so that they read better
- [x] Use fold/unfold octicons

The motivation here is that this is a piece of the Atom UI that package authors will use constantly so let's give it a little polish.
### Before

![screen shot 2014-02-10 at 6 43 45 pm](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/671378/2133511/6dd42bae-92c6-11e3-8afb-4ba9a299f995.png)
### After

![screen shot 2014-02-10 at 7 20 13 pm](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/671378/2133691/83fc6c84-92cb-11e3-9084-260e620646f9.png)

data.title: Changes inspired by Markdown Preview
data.body:
I am [cleaning up](https://github.com/atom/markdown-preview/tree/cj-package-cleanup) Markdown Preview so it can be used as an example for package creators. While doing this I ran into a few things that I want to change in core. Originally this was going to be several pull requests, but yada yada yada I'm just going to do it all in this PR.
1. Remove deferred package deserializers. Markdown Preview was the only package using this and it added unneeded complication to the code.
2. Add WorkspaceView::getActivePaneView (to replace WorkspaceView::getActivePane)
3. Add `expect(something).toHaveFocus()` jasmine expectation
4. Remove Workspace::openSingletonSync and add its functionality to Workspace::open
